cab.content: From Viceroy, Foreign Department, 28th June 1917. (Received at India Office, 10 p.m.) Secret. Mahsud affairs. In response to overtures from Mahsud MaliksDonald with consent of General Officer Commanding has given themguarantee that operations will be suspended during negotiations. Detailsregarding proposed terms of settlement are awaited. This temporarysuspension of operations affords the troops much needed rest, but Beynon isbeing instructed to inform Mahsuds that this guarantee will be withdrawn ifthey endeavour to procrastinate. Troops will remain near Haidaria readv totake further action if Mahsuds show signs of unduly protracting negotiations.
